title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, [22–23? august 1863]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [22–23? August 1863]
text: Dear WaltI write a few lines with Georges letter i received it last wensday and should have sent it before but i have not received the money he writes of going to send i think there must be something wrong about it if i dont get it to day perhaps he was orderdordered away before he could express it i thought maybeemaybe i should have to show the letter to the express but i will send it) mat says she gesses he is going to get married because he said use what i wanted and put the rest in the bank I shall put all i can doodo without in certainly but if he could see Andrew i know he would say mother give him some and let him go in the country if it will doo him good I went down there the other day but O walt how poverty stricken every thing looked it made me feel bad all night and so dirty every thing he thinks of going to rockland lake county next monday i hope it will doo him good we are quite well i feel middling well i am fatter than i was when you went away but i dont feel any better for it i think sometimes not as well i will write again soon i have had anotheanother letter from Heyd he says han is gradualy getting better but is not able to come home miss hattie has torn this letter as usual Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, [22–23? August 1863]
